alert.note: Alert for Coos (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Medford (Southwest Oregon and Northern California)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 16 at 9:08AM PST until January 18 at 6:00PM PST by NWS Medford
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Oregon... Coquille River at Coquille affecting Coos County. For the Coquille River...including Coquille...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL THURSDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Coquille River at Coquille. * WHEN...Until Thursday evening. * IMPACTS...At 23.0 feet, Some farm buildings may be threatened and roads covered in low areas by high water. Expect widespread flooding throughout the Coquille River floodplain. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:45 AM PST Tuesday the stage was 22.5 feet. - Bankfull stage is 20.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 7:45 AM PST Tuesday was 23.7 feet. - Forecast...The river will remain above flood stage through Wednesday night with a maximum value of 22.4 feet late this morning. The river is forecast to hover between bank full at 20 feet and minor flood stage at 21 feet through Thursday, before lowering below bank full around Thursday night. - Flood stage is 21.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 22.4 feet on 02/19/1983. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (9 am PST) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Wed Thu Fri Coquille River Coquille 21.0 22.5 Tue 7 am PST 21.4 20.8 19.9 &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued tomorrow, Wednesday, January 17th around 7 PM PST. late tonight at 315 AM PST.
